Python, Serve My RSS Feed For Me

Author: êï£ C M D R ‚ñë NOVA êï£

Published: 08 Oct 2024


While the dunces in the room are using AI to paint pictures for them, and make one-bar songs, I‚Äôm making little worker bee-bots that aren‚Äôt AI at all, but act more like little tiny butlers for me. Butlers that live inside Debian 12 on a VPS.

Have you ever thought to yourself, ‚ÄúMan, why do I have to copy/paste blog post links and then also post them? I have more important things to do, like jorkin it in the club, you know, with my peanuts.‚Äù

Well, friend, you are in luck today.

Meet Blog-Poster. He‚Äôll dig into your RSS feed, post whatever‚Äôs new straight to Mastodon, and then archive it in a permanent ignore list, just so he‚Äôs sure never to mistake something that‚Äôs old, for something new.

Amazing.

Of course, you can give him a new name, like ‚ÄúBarry‚Äù or ‚ÄúFart Face.‚Äù It doesn‚Äôt matter to me!

I still have lots to learn, and I‚Äôm starting to retain more and more as I do this, but I realize that programming is a very large and long road. Heck. I‚Äôve been screwing with HTML since about 1999, and I still have to keep Google open to reference CSS modules and what-not. Plus, I‚Äôm getting older, and stuff just slips out of my brain juice and then it‚Äôs gone with the wind.

Either way, that‚Äôs all I have to write about for now, cause tomorrow‚Äôs my day off from my offline job, and I‚Äôm about to chill, and do nothing. Or make a 4th bot. I dunno yet.
